additional_citations: Caron, D.A. 2000. Symbiosis and mixotrophy among pelagic microorganisms. In: Kirchman, D.L. (Ed.), Microbial ecology of the oceans, John Wiley & Sons, Inc., New York, pp. 495-523.
importance: This second set of 15 sample submissions includes mixotrophic protists and related heterotrophs from a wide diversity of taxa. We hope looking at these transcriptomes will shed light on evolutionary and ecological adaptation of single celled eukaryotes. Chromulina nebulosa is a mixotrophic Chrysophyte.
